intro: Spermacoce abyssinica, commonly known as African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and opposite leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds. Spermacoce abyssinica is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats.
